#Text=Two dead in storms with no sign of floods letting up in Britain
#Text=Saturday , February 15 , 2014
#Text=Flooding in Staines-upon-Thames .
#Text=Image : Marcin Cajzer .

#Text=Two people have died in incidents related to storms that battered the southern coast of England last night while many across the country continue to struggle with flooding , property damage , and closure of road and railway routes .
#Text=In central London , masonry from a building near Holborn tube station fell on top of a car in the street outside , killing a woman and injuring a man in the car .
#Text=The woman was pronounced dead on the scene ; the man is recovering in hospital and is reported to be in a stable condition .
#Text=A third , female passenger in the car escaped before emergency responders arrived .
#Text=The MS Marco Polo .
#Text=Image : Luca Riva .
#Text=In the English Channel , an 85-year-old man and a woman in her 70s were airlifted from the cruise ship MS Marco Polo which was hit by a large storm wave on its way back to Tilbury , Essex .
#Text=The man subsequently died .
#Text=Other passengers aboard the ship suffered minor injuries .
#Text=The cruise line operator , Cruise & Maritime Voyages ( CMV ) , said in a statement :

#Text=" CMV regrets to advise that earlier today their cruise ship MS Marco Polo , en-route to her home port of Tilbury from the Azores , was hit by a freak wave during adverse sea conditions in the south western approaches of the English Channel .

#Text=The Met Office said that after storms this weekend , weather in the UK should return to  normal winter weather " next week .

column1: #Text=In contrast to the predictions of the Met Office , the Environment Agency have said that floods could remain in some areas of England until March , and that up to 3,000 homes in the Thames Valley could be flooded over the weekend .
#Text=On Friday , they raised the number of " danger to life " level flood warnings from 17 to 24 .

column1: #Text=Flooding across England and Wales has led to thousands being without electricity .
#Text=In North Wales , as of Friday 17,000 people had no electricity supply , while 7,000 homes in Cornwall and Devon had their electricity supply cut off by Friday 's storms .
#Text=Trains operated by Southeastern , Southern , South West Trains , CrossCountry , and First Great Western have been affected .
#Text=Train services to Staines-upon-Thames and Windsor have been replaced by buses .

#Text=Trains on the London to Hastings service have been affected by land-slips between Wadhurst and Battle in East Sussex while trains to East Grinstead and Uckfield have been affected by a land-slip at Oxted in Surrey .
#Text=Services in the south-west have been affected by damage to railway lines in Dawlish .
#Text=Service is not expected to restart for at least six weeks .
#Text=In Devon , buses have replaced trains between Exeter and Newton Abbot .

#Text=The damage to the railway line at Dawlish has been the subject of criticism by passenger group TravelWatch SouthWest who said Network Rail — the company charged with maintaining the British railway network — had been " in complete denial " about the vulnerability of the sea wall .
#Text=The group pointed to a 2004 report they produced arguing for re-routing of railway services on a disused railway in the area .
#Text="

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Had the recommendation in that 2004 report been heeded , the studies would already have been completed , and a clear preferred diversionary route might now be available  , they said .
